question_list.author: Richard English
question_list.text:
Some folks might think cranberry glass
Is for fruit of the cranberry class.
But it's glass of deep red,
With a gold sheen, and said
To be sought by the English top brass.
question_list.question: What is sought by the English top brass?

question_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
question_list.text:
For me, this is clearly the right shift,
The boredom-slash-wild-drunken-fight shift.
It's been called D&D
("Death and donuts," you see).
Yes, there's nothing like working the night shift.
question_list.question: What is the nickname for the night shift in a store?

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
Acidification is handy
(But not in the making of candy).
It stops apples from browning,
And piemen from frowning;
The tartness it adds is just dandy.

limerick_list.author: Charles Silliman
limerick_list.text:
Aucuba japonica's jade,
Long, and leathery leaves seldom fade.
'Variegata' is fine
With its gold flecks that shine
From Zone 7 to 10 in full shade.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
It's a characteristic of man,
Which a good anthropologist can
(After study with care)
Class as nice wavy hair —
Cymotrichous — part of God's plan.

limerick_list.author: Thomas Taylor
limerick_list.text:
A poet, flamboyantly styled,
Was imprisoned — his name was reviled.
When he wrote of this hell
He adopted his cell,
C.3.3, to conceal 'Oscar Wilde'.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I will make you a bet—give me odds—
That from here I can diagnose Rod's
Heart condition just fine.
De Musset's is the sign:
With each one of his heartbeats, he nods.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was liquor dependent at first,
Then with Xanax abuse I was cursed.
My dreadful affliction
Has a name: cross addiction.
Now I'm heroin-hooked. That's the worst.

limerick_list.author: Carol O
limerick_list.text:
A Highlander living in style
Liked socks knit in patterns argyle.
For this diamond-based plaid
He would simply go mad,
Leaving solids and stripes in a pile.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
The language and people Ewenki
Can also be known as Evenki.
We no longer use
The descriptor Tunguz
(Meaning "pig") — to the attitudes then, key.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Puritanical is the mentality
Of some; alas, that's the reality.
So show me a sign
Of what crosses the line
When I write about sex, or carnality.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Here's a very large load for your truck.
Is your cubage sufficient?" asked Chuck.
"My voluminous rig
Has a trailer that's big,"
I replied. "All is well; you're in luck!"

limerick_list.author: Brent Annable
limerick_list.text:
Look, I know that for you it's been tough,
And you're sorry for breaking my stuff.
I can see you regret it —
Chill out! Let's forget it!
Your breast-beating's been quite enough.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
With my fiberless diet, I skulk
To the toilet to struggle and sulk.
For more roughage, I'm told,
Get a cereal sold
By the name of Incredible Bulk.

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A curmudgeon quite tellingly chid
His relations whose manners had slid.
Though he spoke in a wheeze,
His rebuke brought unease,
As he scolded, "Please do as you're bid."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
You lazy accidious lout!
This is it; pack your stuff and get out!
Such a layabout slob,
Get a life!  Get a job!
You're a loser beyond any doubt!

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
She approached my piano, most pissed.
Playing chords, I ignored her.
                                                  "Desist!"
She insisted, and whacked
Down the fallboard. It cracked
Seven fingers and broke my right wrist.

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A leg amputee name of Rollo
Was a fanciful fellow to follow:
When they rolled out a keg,
He would take off his leg
And drink Budweiser right from the hollow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
If your silhouette makes you feel blue,
And your thighs look like mush, here's a clue:
There's no need to feel blah,
Just come out to my spa.
Anticellulite treatment's for you!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Dioscin is found in the yam,
Not the clam, or the lamb, or the ram,
Or arachnids, or ants.
It's a steroid from plants
Used for making your hormone pills, ma'am.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A young monk, gabby Lou, won't employ
Meditation; this tends to annoy.
The head monk dressed him down.
Contrite Lou, with a frown,
Cried, "Hey, abbot, I've been a bad boy!"

limerick_list.author: Goldie
mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Polymerase enzymes must stay
Attached while they make DNA:
Takes an anchor or tether
To keep them together,
Like eukaryotes' PCNA.

limerick_list.author: Frank Luke
limerick_list.text:
Life's a bitch and a battle for some;
You work and you slave for a crumb.
The American Dream—
Not just peaches and cream.
Keep on truckin' or wind up a bum.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The funeral table's replete
With fine pies, and each one's a baked meat.
Every crust, thick and hard,
Can be sealed up with lard.
Lift the lid, take a serving, and eat.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I plan to prepare an anthology
Of lectures explaining cosmology
To insure that my progeny
Will study cosmogeny—
Our cosmos, but not through theology.

limerick_list.author: Egbert
limerick_list.text:
It's abyssal, this zone of the ocean,
Deep and dark, somewhat lacking in motion
Save for these bottom-feeders
(They're stony-faced bleeders).
I gave one a kiss — no emotion.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
Feeling down? She'll drop all to attend,
And a listening ear she will lend,
Plus a shoulder to cry on.
The one you rely on
In good times and bad is a friend.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Braxton Hicks? A new comet's been found?
A duet with a funkier sound?
An accord ending war,
Or a stock set to soar?
No, they're squeezes from wombs baby-bound.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
We were playing the Dozens that night, sir.
His description of Momma ain't right, sir:
Sure, the bitch is a junky,
But she ain't no old monkey.
I offed the damn fool in a fight, sir.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In old cities you'll commonly find
There's a large place of worship designed
To command the main square.
As a rule, folks stop there
Just to stare; few to pray or unwind.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
For herbivorous beasts called gelada,
Ethiopia's home, not Nevada.
These are monkeys — robust,
With a rock-climbing lust.
And you've not seen one yet? You've just gotta.

limerick_list.author: David R. Litwin
limerick_list.text:
"Foul fool, you have ruined my life!
You have taken my beautiful wife!"
So he cuffed the young man:
Slapped him silly and ran —
Now the wife's life is quite rife with strife.

limerick_list.author: AndrewB
limerick_list.text:
He thought dipping tobacco would mean
He'd stay safe from the cancer he'd seen.
But although he's still young,
Surgeons cut out his tongue:
A glossectomy done on a teen.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The old barnstormers cried with despair,
"We've no longer the stomach to scare
Folks with spirals and dives
That endanger our lives,
Just for air shows we give at the fair."

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The little girl asked, "Do you mind
If I keep every one I can find
Of those caterpillars that
On your cabbage grow fat?"
"No — of course," said the gardener. (How kind!)

limerick_list.author: Julia
limerick_list.text:
A company union is one
That a boss will endorse and then run.
Contradiction in terms?
Still, attractive to firms
That have fought the class war and have won.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Sue's abdominal area was bloated,
So the docs tried ballottement.  They voted?
No, they prodded and poked,
And the action provoked
Susie's organs to bob, since they floated.

limerick_list.author: mrsrev
limerick_list.text:
This plant isn't where you get joe,
And it's not found wherever you go,
Yet it's called coffee fern—
Leaves are green, then red turn—
Graceful cliff brake's  a beautiful show.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
A bad time at bedtime's required
When toddlers behave like they're wired.
Though we send them to bed,
They come downstairs instead,
And insist that they're simply not . . . (yawn!)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There's a sign: a particular stock
That for weeks now has sunk like a rock
Has reversed this down trend.
It's a bull trap, my friend.
Any urges to buy I would block.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie
limerick_list.text:
In the South, if you're craving caffeine
But you haven't a leaf or a bean,
Pick some yaupon and brew it—
Then drink.  You won't rue it.
(It's tea: Appalachian, not green.)

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"What's your job?" Sarah wrote the new guy,
But "Fg Off" was his texted reply.
"Well, how rude!" Sarah stewed.
I explained that the dude
Was an officer sent here to fly.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
In a jostling Los Angeles pack,
Zola Budd, who ran barefoot on track,
With the favourite collided,
Who fell. Though derided,
Budd finished the race, but way back.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
There was calorie-rich chocolate sauce
On my ice cream—a shiny brown gloss,
But my mom grabbed the cup
And said (eating it up),
"Don't be cross, dear.  My gain is your loss."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The teens had a great explanation:
They were giving a free demonstration
Of communal unzipping—
Denudement, or stripping.
What a way to display denudation!

limerick_list.author: David Bourke
limerick_list.text:
Would apnoea be repetition,
As we've apnea done, in this mission?
Since it could lead to death,
Better not hold your breath
While you wait for a new definition.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Isn't architectonic akin
To the plates underneath the earth's skin?
Or—now, this is conjectural—
What architectural
Types like to drink with their gin?

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
The young lad, who is fresh out of school,
Has homed in on a girl playing pool.
He eyes well-rounded hips
And then moistens his lips;
Mouth agape now, he can't help but drool.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Without slaves, ancient Romans relate,
A colonus would work your estate.
He was "free" but a serf
Who was tied to the turf,
And paid rent — a solution first-rate.

limerick_list.author: a.groovymind
limerick_list.text:
That arch-libertine Dorian Gray
Led a life both licentious and gay.
He held on to his youth
At a cost, for in truth
What became of his portrait — oy vey!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
A viper, asleep on the shore,
Met a mongoose he'd battled before.
His attacks were all thwarted
Once more, and he snorted
With aspish aspersions galore.

limerick_list.author: alkahuna
limerick_list.text:
It's been said if you're born with a caul
You'll have talents the world to enthrall —
Second sight, wealth and fame,
People hailing your name —
But it's just superstition, that's all.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
"We're unable to moor the Valdez,
And the captain's a grouch we can't please,"
Thought a mate in the crew
On the tanker who knew
Joe's  cantankerous state on the seas.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
The Digital Compact Cassette—
The (supposedly) best format yet—
Was an out-and-out flop.
Home recorders pressed Stop,
And fast-forwarded it to Forget.

limerick_list.author: skipjordan
limerick_list.text:
My eye doctor said, "You've a stye,
But don't worry, you surely won't die."
Then he slipped with his shiv—
Should that flub I forgive?
Do you think I should turn a blind eye?

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Whence the line that includes Texas tea?
What's its source? A great film or TV?
Got a tune in your head
Named "The Ballad of Jed..."?
All from crude oil that dude hit for free!

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The ritual churching of wives,
Soon after their baby arrives:
A purification
Without medication;
A blessing and purging of lives.

limerick_list.author: hwindle
limerick_list.text:
In The Son of the Mummy-Bride III,
It's the state of the cerecloth that's key.
Bindings, prone to unwrap,
Hang in tatters and flap,
Boosting creepiness up a degree.

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Our tree-swinging cousin's a fellow
Who's mostly mild-mannered and mellow.
Should you grab, though, a grape
From a mild, mellow ape,
He will slash you with fangs long and yellow.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Body snatching's a terrible deed,
So for Grandfather's graveyard, I'll plead
For a watchman who keeps
A close eye on the creeps
Who for bones have a jones and a need.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Freeze him out, no compunctions, no pity.
I don't care if his dad owns the city.
The creep's widely abhorred.
If he isn't ignored,
I've got plans for him — none of them pretty.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The editor rose from his chair.
To the playwright he said, with a glare:
"Though your writing is fine,
You've too much in each line;
Please delete a few words here and there."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Now that Ida's been kindly invited
To visit Shanghai, she's delighted.
She's eager and keen
To drink in every scene—
And some Tsingtao. She's mighty excited.

limerick_list.author: psh
limerick_list.text:
Though bones Mother Hubbard stored there,
Her old cupboard, at times, was quite bare.
She lived (likely) alone,
For the storage of bone
Causes odors unlike your Gruyère.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Agrypnias (wanting for slumber)
On occasion my nighttimes encumber.
When it bugs me to wake,
There are drugs that I take:
Agrypnotics too daunting to number.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"A ditrochee's awkward within
My new limerick," said Lynne with chagrin.
"Using anapest meter,
I feel like a cheater
When I write the name Huckleberry Finn."

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Gun control gives the Senate the runs.
It's a topic McConnell oft shuns.
GOP members dominate
But some start to bombinate.
Will that buzz turn to action on guns?

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
"Son, she lives on the bad edge of town,"
(Meaning border) Dad said with a frown.
"She's no good," Mom agrees.
We're in love, no one sees.
They'll feel bad when the two of us drown.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
Kim Jong at the zoo: "I demand a
New bear cub for state propaganda.
If mating of Ping Ping
With Long Dong goes 'ding ding',
Then four-month gestation: new panda."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
As the water swirls down from your drain,
Give a thought to its rush through the main.
Have you ductile iron pipe?
That's the flexible type,
Which they claim will stand up to the strain.

limerick_list.author: Bluebelle and JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
A confusing young lady, called Brenda,
Cross-dressed to escape her male gender.
She started as 'he',
Then he dressed as a 'she',
Using falsies that Doris would lend her.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Every sacrifice bid or finesse
I attempt meets with little success.
Playing bridge is a strain
That has made me insane,
So I'm thinking of switching to chess.

limerick_list.author: DenmarK
limerick_list.text:
Is Materials Science a topic
Where properties stay isorropic?
If in any dimension
There's change of intention,
Then no! 'Cause that's aeolotropic.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
Señores, it's sure great to see ya
In New Mexico's town Agua Fria.
It's here, I've been told,
That the water's damn cold;
Going swimming's a loco idea.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Every highlander gardener in Grampian
Is fond of the flowering campion.
It's a lychnis that grows
And competes with the rose.
In the pink and in shows, it's a champion.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
Back and forth, he has carried the news —
Now from south back to north he's brought views
To the leaders who heard
Not his voice but his word;
Now their own marches miles in his shoes.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
I am nubile, and flaunt my facility
To glow with potential fertility;
Rich and single, he's eligible:
"I do", if intelligible,
Will witness our joint suitability.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
Out here, on a spacefaring mission,
Finding air is my dearest ambition.
Certain death is my fate
If I breathlessly wait
For a less anaerobic condition.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
In a Bateman cartoon, there's a crowd,
Who are staring, aghast, at the cowed
And repentant poor clot
With a look: "He said what?!"
He regrets having said it aloud.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
limerick_list.text:
See the skin, tossed away when unzipped,
Hit the floor, squashed by Ethel who slipped,
Landing flat on her back.
Watch the patients' cool crack:
They are going bananas; they've flipped!

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
In our burial ground there's a grave
Of a man who was held as a slave
Just because he was black.
He came under attack
And was cruelly killed by a knave.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
In a wine-seller's cellar, poor Rollo
Wasn't told he should spit, and not swallow.
Now he's already wasted
On whites that he's tasted,
With Burgundy reds still to follow.

limerick_list.author: rbalexx
limerick_list.text:
Your bewitchery casts a strong spell
Of sheer magic on me since I fell.
The enchantment I feel
Is sublime, but unreal.
If I'm lost, that's just fine. This is swell.

limerick_list.author: proof and danmcgrath
limerick_list.text:
Abduction! By whom? The solution:
Their call suggests clear attribution.
Joe was kidnapped. He's small,
Yet they said he was tall,
So the gang must be all Lilliputian.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Some beach towns in France are such meanies:
No more fully-garbed Islamist teenies!
Seems some towns near to Cannes
Passed a dubious ban
On strange burqa/bikini burkinis.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Most often, parental unease'll
Disappear like a hen-stealing weasel.
But my parents take sides
When it comes to their rides—
Mom's electric, while Pop goes for diesel.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
There is little that might make me gladder
Than curing this pain in my bladder.
My cystalgia's the pits.
I assure you that it's
Guaranteed to make anyone sadder.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What is formatting?  Work I revile:
Arranging my poems in a style
That obeys arcane rules
Set by pig-headed mules.
Use italics? Use quotes? What a trial!

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Said the Devil, "Hi, welcome to Hell.
Seems your gunfight did not go too well.
Guess it wasn't much fun
When you noticed your gun
Had no bullet, but just a blank shell."

limerick_list.author: Nitelaf
limerick_list.text:
The archdeaconry had a new minister
Whose methods were strange, though not sinister.
For Communion — a Ritz!
And he'd sit in the schvitz
For the baptisms he would administer.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
He worked close-up magic with me.
How it happened, I just couldn't see.
Subtle hands, easy chat,
And he had me — like that.
I just saw what I wanted to be.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
When the style's alla prima, it's quick:
Just one layer of paint—not too thick.
For the artist, this try's
All he gets 'cause it dries
Very fast and the images stick.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Nothing happens by accident, Kevin.
Your time hadn't come to see Heaven."
But in mishaps some die,
And I have to ask, "Why
Is it my roll came up lucky seven?"

limerick_list.author: Mary
limerick_list.text:
A late-blooming student named Erica
Made a typo. She wrote: "Just hysterica
Is the way that I  felt
When I learned what was dealt
The Confederate States of America."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
On TV, we can see Marcia Brady
Is prim, every inch the young lady.
"Every other inch" might
Fit the actress just right
Since her past, she confesses, is shady.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Anastasia, the Tsar's youngest daughter,
Was thought to have hid from the slaughter
By some who would rather
She'd ruled like her father.
My theory? The Bolsheviks caught 'er.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Ctenizidae (now Ctenizoidea)
In their homebuilding might have employed ya
To conceal their trap-doors
In the cool forest floors;
But, as spiders, they'd rather avoid ya.

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
The original post-office spam
Is the bulk mail the mailman will jam
In your mailbox each fall,
So you'll send Uncle Paul
A big Hickory Farms Christmas ham.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
My ambition? Most friends wouldn't guess
The pursuit I must now disprofess.
A ladies' romancer,
A Chippendale dancer,
Needs a body that I don't possess.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An amasser collects lots of stuff
And to change his behavior is tough
When many a trunk
Is filled up with his junk
And no quantity's ever enough.

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
In a chair, in despair, he sits slumped,
As if thumped, and he's totally stumped.
Feeling too stunned to cry,
He's left wondering why
She walked out with the words, "You've been dumped."

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
The polygamist desperately strives
To hang onto his various wives.
Each one would be missed,
So he'll try to resist
Their desire to have disparate lives.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
If you want your home garden to grow,
You should break clumps of soil with a hoe.
Maybe plant some potatoes,
Green beans, or tomatoes.
(Marijuana's illegal, you know.)

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
A double-pipe cooler or heater,
Countercurrently used, is much neater
Than in cocurrent flow,
Which is easy to show
Theoretically, or with a meter.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Brown-bag lunches, it's true, don't convey
Any sense of achievement today.
I may look like a jerk
To the others at work,
But I like good ol' PB&J!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
This story is Harlan McDougal's.
He's astounded whenever he googles.
When he got up this morn
And googled his horn,
His mind boggled at oodles on flügels.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A bulge on the bill of a bird.
A diviner who's good as his word.
A catch on a gun
Or a burn mark (no fun).
Dried out, or to wrap those interred.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"Define worship," I bade Cousin Davey,
As we ate mashed potatoes and gravy.
Davey thought, bit his lip.
"Not a fortified ship;
Adoration," he said, "—of the Navy."

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"Hey, commish, love the job that you do!
You're top dog to our people in blue,
And you really are great!"
"Thanks, but just so we're straight,
That's commissioner, rookie, to you."

limerick_list.author: proof
limerick_list.text:
Who can possibly count all the dubs,
The increasing, unending mass flubs,
Each gaffe and each  blunder
That's tearing asunder
The inept, the mistake-prone, the Cubs.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When Chief Shoe Thief returned from his toot,
He canned me. I'd kept stolen loot:
One right boot.  (I'm bereft
Of a leg, yes, the left.)
Got the boot, but did not get the boot.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
The removal of links in that chain
Which makers and buyers maintain
Is disintermediation,
Now a growing temptation
To save money, or profits sustain.

limerick_list.author: BobHale
limerick_list.text:
In charge of the Islamic state
(750 to 1258)
Were Abbasid caliphs
Who held the beliefs
That Abbas and Mohammed relate.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
In orchards of valleys and hills,
Armillaria mellea kills.
It causes disease
On the roots of some trees—
Giving orchardists multiple chills.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The engraver, much skilled with the burin,
Sold prints to the princes of Turin.
When he proudly avowed
That he'd printed the shroud,
They provided a cell to abjure in.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
"Can you not hear that chatter? Then hark!
It says, 'Stop the lathe now!' If not, Clark,
It's like doin' some cloggin'
On top of yer noggin;
It's gonna," I said, "leave a mark."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I was asked for a date by Nate Dudley.
He is short, and he speaks Elmer Fudd-ly.
He's a bit overweight,
But he owns an estate,
So I rate him an eight—soft (he's cuddly).

limerick_list.author: Robert Holland
limerick_list.text:
Fragile beauty can heal all the world.
How precious it is when unfurled!
Simple truth's stunning flower
Possesses the power
To open a fist tightly curled.

limerick_list.author: SusanL
limerick_list.text:
We all live at the mercy of God.
He has numbered the days we will plod
Down this path we call life.
He is there in our strife.
If we're faithful, He'll give us the nod.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
DIY is a passion for Bill
And he's got lots of bits for his drill.
Black and Decker in hand,
He just can't understand
Why his missus is writing her will.

limerick_list.author: Jim Vincent
limerick_list.text:
She dreamed about love and romance
As she furtively eyed him, one glance.
Her quick peek was perfected;
It went undetected
[Except by the author, perchance].

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
Some seeds ride the wind on their own;
Others, eaten by birds, will be flown.
But dispersal design
For the seeds of a pine
Has a squirrel transporting their cone.

limerick_list.author: otherwisefine
limerick_list.text:
On a plane, it can damage your ear,
Or your sinus, if pressure won't clear.
Or it could make the lung
Of a diver go bung.
Barotrauma can be quite severe.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
When the judge pronounced sentence, he said, "It
Is murder you aided/abetted —
You assisted/incited!"
My sentence (I'll fight it):
Ten years!  Then my trousers I wetted.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
An actress in France gave the name
To this dish and achieved lasting fame,
So we'll never forget.
As dessert, crêpe suzette
Sets both platter and passions aflame.

limerick_list.author: Morimando
limerick_list.text:
If you see, are aroused, so must touch
Every tree, then you love them too much!
No mere buff nor a fan,
You're a dendrophile, man!
Oaks and maples? Stop pining for such!

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
In the glacier are strata galore
That the scientists wish to explore.
Going in's a bit chill,
So they get out their drill,
And extract a nice sample — a core.

limerick_list.author: Harris Risman
limerick_list.text:
Crafty Bigthan told wily old Teresh,
"That mean  Persian king ought to perish."
This plan to put down
The man with the crown
Was revealed by a guy whom we cherish.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE
limerick_list.text:
The French call this river Escaut
(It's Schelde to Belgian folks, though).
Fleming H. van de Velde
Was born near the Schelde,
And it's Scheldt which in Britain they know.

limerick_list.author: PdeG
limerick_list.text:
There was a young monk from Bhutan
Whose robe was in need of a darn.
He spun thread off the back
Of a passing old yak.
Now there's an improbable yarn.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Cav and Pag are two opera one-acters.
Played together, they've damned few detractors.
Pag's got clowns, pleases millions,
And Cav's got Sicilians;
In both, love and murder are factors.

limerick_list.author: Chris Young
limerick_list.text:
See my girls (what a beauteous bevy!) —
Nicely curved, not too slim, not too heavy.
This bevy of beauties
Can do household duties!
(If you marry, expect a small levy…)

limerick_list.author: Recumbentman
limerick_list.text:
Though preserving dead parents may keep
Their cadavers in semblance of sleep,
It is not recommended.
Their sojourn here ended,
Cremate them, or bury them deep.

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
If you study, and reach your potential,
You'll receive your essential credential.
You'll be courted, acclaimed,
Influential and famed,
More important and more consequential.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
There's a rich golden tone to our brew.
Nature's flavonoids lend it that hue.
And there's no call to panic:
They're healthful, organic,
Aromatic—good stuff through and through

limerick_list.author: GeneralE
limerick_list.text:
To empty your boat you must bail,
And I don't mean like get out of jail.
There's no reason to worry,
But still, please, just hurry!
Grasp hold of the bail on this pail.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
The element chromium's source
Is the mineral chromite, of course.
And it's chrome that I like
On the wheels of my bike
And the spurs that I use on my horse.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Adobe flat: gently sloped plain
Made of clay spread that way by the rain.
When it's dry it will get
Smooth and hard, and I'll bet
Some remain from the drained rain in Spain.

limerick_list.author: Comicoffee
limerick_list.text:
If you're making focaccia dough,
There's an item you'll need for it, Joe.
Use some active dry yeast
So its bulk is increased.
Otherwise, you'll have matzoh, you know?

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
My A-to-Z limerick tool
Goes from A's "aa-bb-a" rule
On to D's "diddy dum"
(That's the beat I must strum)
Until Z's "zany endings are cool!"

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
For fun and good causes they play.
They're just dabblers with jobs in the day.
Now Beats Workin' has lost
Tony Snow.  What's the cost?
He'll be missed more than music can say.

limerick_list.author: John Young
limerick_list.text:
To make my wife smile, I seem powerless—
I wish I could get her to glower less.
Her birthday? Oh no!
I forgot it, and so
I have left her both chocolate and flowerless.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Hardened boilerplate's crusting the snow.
Tread with caution wherever you go:
It'll hold then desert you,
And swiftly invert you…
You're sliding? Just go with the flow.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When a guy with guitar wants to croon
To his gal 'neath the silvery moon,
To be ready he must—
Not adapt or adjust—
I guess the best word is attune.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Boss, you've never come close to that place.
I've been over it twice, just in case.
So sit back and relax,
'Cause I've covered your tracks:
No papers or prints — not a trace.

limerick_list.author: waterrocks
limerick_list.text:
We objected to what we'd been shown,
And we forcefully made our views known.
Their minor concession
Won't ease our aggression —
They've thrown us a meaningless bone.

limerick_list.author: Jacqui Brown
limerick_list.text:
His watchful eyes focused and steely,
He toiled up the tall campanile.
As the old priest ascended,
The tolling bells blended
And shadows fell swiftly, surreally.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A bento's a Japanese lunch
Made with rice and with veggies that crunch.
It is served in a box,
And it may include lox;
That you'll like it a lot is my hunch.

limerick_list.author: bob killian
limerick_list.text:
By the Evil Ones I am pursued,
So my shelter must always include
Distilled water so pure
That for years I'll endure,
Reconstructing dehydrated food.

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
This month had a full, then a new;
Now a second full moon comes in view.
As a metaphor there
For the odd and the rare,
This moon we refer to as blue.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Joe Beaver inquired of his maw,
"This tree—should we purchase a saw
To fell it? A chopper?
Would hatchets be proper?"
Said his mother, laconically: "Gnaw."

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Thought America, "Baghdad is busted!
Its chemical weapons are clustered
In silos and bunkers."
But some wars are clunkers:
Seems all Iraq's missiles had rusted.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
To advance in your job, one ingredient
Is to always seem sweet and obedient,
But within, nurse a thirst
To keep your interests first.
To succeed, do whatever's expedient.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I pray that you ladies excuse
My three sneezes, with forceful "achoos."
So fast did they issue,
I hadn't a tissue;
I fear I have moistened your shoes.

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
The baker, a grumpy old fart,
Is well past the prime of his art.
The reviews of his peers
That he oft volunteers
Are always both crusty and tart.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
As he's cutting, the surgeon intones,
"Well, at least I am not hearing groans."
He is fully engrossed
As he carves up the roast.
"This keen catlin works well between bones."

limerick_list.author: neilski
limerick_list.text:
It's descending, this triangle: lows
On a level, highs dropping. This shows
That the share price you pay
May not last past today.
Better sell, the wise stockbroker knows.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
In the '50s, Lord Mancroft once said
That from Bristol, no prisoner fled.
"If escapes make the news,
We don't say that. We use
Dematerialization instead."

limerick_list.author: Wattlebird
limerick_list.text:
Holy moly, our goalie was great
Till he blew the big game.  He let eight
Of the pucks in the net!
How much worse can it get
When you're watching the game with your mate?

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
She's magnetic; her smart conversation
Can attract any guy in the nation,
But the folks in the know
Say it's all a big show.
You get close? There's depolarization.

limerick_list.author: GaZoom
limerick_list.text:
His digging in Egypt was backed
To seek treasure long hidden, intact.
Howard Carter sought gold—
Tutankhamun got rolled.
Eight more years it would take to extract.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
What is used for closed-captions or crawl
Is a chyron.  I'm sure that that's all
That your broadcast will need
To display text they feed —
And drive viewers like me up a wall.

limerick_list.author: Fred Harris
limerick_list.text:
A cellist I know said, "It's funny,
But here's why my mood's always sunny:
I pick up my bow,
And I smile, 'cause I know
That I work a big fiddle for money!"

limerick_list.author: Jeter Coffee and Workshop
limerick_list.text:
The voluptuous torso of Dottie—
What a body!  She's really a hottie.
I once sneaked a peek,
And it made my knees weak.
(It turns out that she teaches karate.)

limerick_list.author: jojo
limerick_list.text:
My mom had a penchant linguistic,
For short witty maxims simplistic.
She'd serve up a sermon
In tones like Ms. Merman,
In one single phrase aphoristic.

limerick_list.author: Roger Dunn
rusty
proof
limerick_list.text:
My ascent to the top was all planned;
I would offer the boss my demand:
A step up and a raise,
Six weeks off (sixty days),
But my terrible math got me canned.

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Three on offense? If one guy should meet 'em,
That's a three-on-one break. They should beat 'im.
That's how hockey is played.
But that one's unafraid?
A defender first grade? He'll defeat 'em!

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Your limerick impresses and awes.
It gets four RFAs and applause.
Its approval's a lock—
Then you reel from the shock
As a prickly AE lists its flaws.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
Their reaction left no room to wiggle,
Though "the Donald" decided to niggle.
"They laughed with me," he said,
And not at me." Instead,
He caused millions more people to giggle.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Look for land. Stay awake. Keep on rowing.
(I can feel my adrenalin flowing.)
To this one chantlike thought,
For support, I resort — 
Keep going, keep going, keep going!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
A nutritional breakfast his aim,
Founder Kellogg had garnered acclaim
Mixing corn, flavored malt,
Sugar, syrup, and salt.
Kellogg's Corn Flakes, the cereal's name.

limerick_list.author: Chuck Folkers
limerick_list.text:
Peter Pan, many actresses say,
Is the role they were destined to play.
In a breeches part, dressed
As a man, they feel blessed,
Though they're neither transvestites nor gay.

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Jack's misdeeds he was careful to hide;
What we thought might be true he denied.
That dark life that he led
Remained hid in his head
When he went to his grave — when he died.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Till their vision of justice prevailed,
Many foes of apartheid were jailed,
Such as Nelson Mandela,
A singular fella.
In the end, 'twas apartheid that failed.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
Conjuncture's when things come together,
Like job loss, divorce, stormy weather,
Dead dog, diarrhea —
At once. Mamma mia!
Your brain might come loose from its tether.

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
The carnifex pressed him with stones,
Adding weight straight from matins to nones,
While flaying the rest,
Leaving arms, legs and chest
Unfleshed, excarnificated bones.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Hark the tooting and trumpeting sounds —
There's a bugle-man riding the grounds.
Now the chase comes this way!
There's a fox gone to bay.
Hear the baying approach of the hounds.

limerick_list.author: Richard Stehr
limerick_list.text:
Julia Child, in death, moved on high
To that great kitchen up in the sky,
Where Saint Pete she would greet
With a "Bon appétit!"
And to taste her cuisine, folks would die.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Don Adams is known for his part
As the spy Maxwell Smart on Get Smart.
He created this shtick
Playing dick, Byron Glick,
On Bill Dana's show.  Real comic art!

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Endovenous: by means of a vein
Or inside one.  When patients complain,
Intravenous injection
Of meds by direction
Of doctors will often ease pain.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Counted cross-stitch? Its heart is a chart
Full of symbols, the craft's signal part.
A vast palette of flosses
And stitches like crosses
Make a mighty fine stand-in for art.

limerick_list.author: Len Farano
limerick_list.text:
"My nuke button is bigger than yours.
When I press, it will open the doors
To both fire and fury.
Let the world be the jury."
Two loose cannons risk nuclear wars.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
Romans left, then the Anglii came
West from Jutland to stake out their claim
To a part of east Britain—
With which they were smitten.
Now England's derived from their name.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
The fund Comic Relief, in UK,
Supports famine relief. Red Nose Day
Just might lead you to think
A red nose means we drink.
No, they're worn just for fun, and they pay!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"All the cattle are penned," said my pal,
"In a very convenient locale,
Where I'll teach them harmonious
Moos, not erroneous
Lowing—a bovine chorale."

limerick_list.author: Chris J. Strolin
limerick_list.text:
Though I love you, Charlene, muh-muh-madly,
There's a problem suh-suh-suh-suh-sadly
On account of thuh-the
Fact I buh-buh-buh-buh-
-buh-buh-buh-buh-balbucinate badly.

limerick_list.author: S. A. McBurnie and Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
I was just getting into my goading
When he said, "This here gun's autoloading."
Without pause to reload
He soon filled my abode
Full of holes, and my mind with foreboding.

limerick_list.author: pöt
limerick_list.text:
In Sumer, the god of the air
And the king of the gods worshipped there,
Was called En-lil, and he
Let the tempests roam free,
Which could lead to a nasty affair.

limerick_list.author: Jane Auerbach
limerick_list.text:
From the bathroom, there came a commotion:
Seems her ring, as she'd smoothed on some lotion,
Slipped and plunked in the bowl.
She yelled, "Damage control!"
He retrieved it. Now that is devotion!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
While spraying my uncle's canoe,
On the faucet I scribbled a few
Loop-de-loops where it bent
In an angled descent.
On the bibcock a doodle I drew.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
As the wheel of a wagon goes 'round,
A gymnast can spin 'cross the ground.
Limbs fully extended,
A cartwheel is splendid
(With none of the cart's squeaky sound).

limerick_list.author: neilski
mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
I surmise, watching stars from a hill,
That the cosmos has spirit and will.
Cosmozoism teaches
That life moves the reaches
Of space.  I feel suddenly chill.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
You poor baby, ah diddums, my bad
For not knowing the reasons you're sad:
First the ticket for speeding,
Now that cat scratch — you're bleeding!
What a run of misfortune you've had.

limerick_list.author: speedysnail
limerick_list.text:
Beatlemania gave them a fright,
So a movie recorded their plight.
The soundtrack is teeming
With cause for the screaming:
It's hardly a hard day or night.

limerick_list.author: Bob Egg
limerick_list.text:
The manager spat at half time:
"I know it's a steep hill to climb.
Just go back out and score."
So we scored forty more —
But still lost by a point. What a crime!

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Two disciples ensepulchred Christ,
Wrapped in linens quite heavily spiced.
My belief?  Then a guard
Didn't try very hard
To stop robbers who planned a Christ heist.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Charged with speeding and hauled into court,
Werner Heisenberg's heard to retort,
"The police cannot prove
Where I was on the move
If they're sure of the speed they report."

limerick_list.author: Ritepath
limerick_list.text:
At my log cabin home near the eddy,
My antenna reception's not steady.
Swirling water is fine
But for telly I pine—
The house wasn't built cable-ready.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Any sense or good judgment you had
Is now gone.  This revue is just bad.
What's this old song and dance?
If you think you've a chance
To succeed with these follies, you're mad.

limerick_list.author: Duncan Stevens
limerick_list.text:
Said Joe Croc to his friend, Allie Gator,
"Alas for Sam Shark in Decatur
With some lady named Beth,
Forced to fight to the death!"
"Poor Sam!" answered Al. "Gladiator."

limerick_list.author: DBRHoffman
limerick_list.text:
My writings are often entwined
With words of the four-letter kind.
My tone is ferocious,
My grammar, atrocious;
But my cursive is neat and refined.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
"In this crate, I'll surprise her," thought Dale,
But the post office workers would fail
To decipher his scrawl.
None could read it at all.
Undelivered, he wound up dead mail.

limerick_list.author: turnip
limerick_list.text:
Though these moccasins really appeal,
Don't you slip one on over your heel.
Shoo these rainbow snakes, Sweet;
They can grow to four feet
Eating solely an eel for each meal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
The daiquiri's made out of rum
And the juices of fruits. Every bum
At the poolside or beach
Keeps one near, within reach.
I succumb every summer. Yum, yum!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
We're apportioning wealth so each heir
Will receive her proportionate share.
As we oftentimes say,
"There's a will? There's a way,"
While we strive to arrive at what's fair.

limerick_list.author: Jeff Foster
limerick_list.text:
The didgeridoo choir blew it:
That chord had such dissonance to it!
Asked alto to bass
(With a rather red face),
"Was my G flat, or did yer E do it?"

limerick_list.author: Janet McConnaughey
limerick_list.text:
Once it was out of the ground,
The Cullinan Diamond was found
To weigh many a carat.
Some gems of great merit
Were cut from it — stones that astound.

limerick_list.author: sl8ofhand
limerick_list.text:
At the all-cryptid dinner, young Meti
Tickled Tina, a finely shaped Yeti.
The reflexes, abdominal,
Of the snowgirl (abominable)
Made Tina cough up her spaghetti.

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
If my tribe is attacked I'll deny
The aggressors and fervently cry:
"My beliefs I'll defend,
And resist to the end."
I'm fanatically willing to die!

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
Hoist a pot to His Majesty's Guard.
May disloyalty ever be barred!
Wash your gullet with porter —
A pottle, no shorter —
Down a long leathern blackjack, well-tarred.

limerick_list.author: David Bourke
limerick_list.text:
A mind like a sieve? Fret no more.
Aides-mémoire are a way to restore.
You won't have to think twice,
With some note or device.
It's French. I've forgotten what for.

limerick_list.author: sallycello
limerick_list.text:
When you're trolling for carp, don't complain
If the fish are not biting. Refrain
From all carping and whining;
The day's bright and shining.
Carpe diem — break out the champagne.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Despite clouds at the beach, I had fun,
Fell asleep, then awoke around one.
The sky was ablaze
From old Sol and his gaze.
I got burned by a bitch of a sun.

limerick_list.author: Bill Middleton
limerick_list.text:
The poor dodo is no longer heard.
It is gone, and "extinct" is the word.
It's now famous, it's said,
For the fact that it's dead,
This gentle and comical bird.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My friend Skip, though he often is tipsy,
Is the cleverest guy in Poughkeepsie.
Even drunk (so I've heard),
He'll define any word,
So I ask: "What's a faw?" "It's a gypsy."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
My hairdresser says that its blueness
Enhances this liquid's shampooness.
For a human or pet,
It's the best you can get,
And its hue won't engender tabooness.

limerick_list.author: alan meyer
limerick_list.text:
The anophelines, not at all new,
Carry pathogens tough to subdue.
In Brazil, it's malaria;
On the Nile, add filaria.
These mosquitoes spread viruses, too.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
I choose, cafeteria style,
To date women with looks that beguile.
Choice of dishes is vast,
So I'll pass 'em by fast
If they're planning to walk down the aisle.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
I'm a freethinker!  Oh, did I mention? —
No dogma have I, nor pretension.
See, my logic's so tight
I'm convinced that I'm right
All the time, and I brook no dissension.

limerick_list.author: Peter Meyer
limerick_list.text:
AJ: that's Auberge de Jeunesse,
French Youth Hostel Service. Access
Is by membership card,
And you may well regard
Such a place as a low-cost address.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Whether Macintosh, Spy, or Delicious,
An apple is always nutritious,
And one eaten each day
Keeps my doctor at bay
(He's my husband, so that's injudicious).

limerick_list.author: Dr. Work
limerick_list.text:
Uncle Sam's advertising campaign
Was supposed to help smokers abstain.
The ads did help them quit—
The unfortunate bit
Was it got them to take up cocaine.

limerick_list.author: JimInRoses
limerick_list.text:
Chromatophores help the chameleon
Change colour, so Aristotelian
Herpetologists squint
At its tint: now it's mint,
Now it's brown — write this down: vaudevillian.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Our factory isn't equipped
To containerize goods to be shipped,
So I outsourced the task
To the guy with the flask,
Though his boxes are dull, nondescript.

limerick_list.author: Carol June Hooker
limerick_list.text:
Pulmonologists use—with compunctions—
Caffeine citrate; although this drug functions
As a cardio- (heart)
-acceleratory (quick start),
It prompts breathing and calms bronchial junctions.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Caveman Dana was brought to his knees
By his latest invention: a cheese
From the milk of great woolly
She-mammoths. He'd fully
Expected to milk them with ease!

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
It's just bull, and a trifle absurd,
That the boss of the bossies demurred
When she heard that she now
Is a bossier cow
Since becoming the head of the herd.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
"We'll use colors direct from the sky.
They'll go easy," she said, "on the eye."
On our first anniversary,
We're bedecking a nursery.
There's no need, I suspect, to say why.

limerick_list.author: Partypoet
limerick_list.text:
The belt bag's a recent invention —
To carry small things, its intention.
But with all of my gear,
I've abused it, I fear.
It's suffering now from distention!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
A disease with results that are tragic,
Black measles (it's called  hemorrhagic),
Has no treatment or cure,
But what's more, and for sure,
Vaccination prevents it—like magic!

limerick_list.author: Tim Alborn
limerick_list.text:
Said Monsieur, without further ado,
"Shall we kindle affection anew?
Let us drain some champagne
On the plain by the Maine—
Just us two, me and you, in Anjou."

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
The band started playing "La Bamba"
So I kicked up a passionate samba.
My girlfriend said, "Oy!
That's a cha-cha, old boy!
Dinchu never take dance? Ai, caramba!"

limerick_list.author: mephistopheles
limerick_list.text:
When a triangle's trying to hide,
It should stand, not in front nor beside,
But behind, end-to-end,
With its congruent friend,
So their triangle sides coincide.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Through the whole of the freshman semester,
Lester pestered my best buddy Hester.
Then she called him a heel,
Which hurt Les a great deal,
And the wound wouldn't heal—only fester.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
Actuarial science? Oh, dear!
That's a subject (for me) very near,
Though insurance mathematics
And death-stat fanatics
Suggest a profession that's drear.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What's the meaning," you ask, "of cubicular?"
It relates to one room in particular—
Where you sleep every night,
And you furthermore might
Have some fun that is extra-curricular.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Shrilly fifing, the fifer came near.
A loud shriek from his flute we could hear.
Though Mom cried: "It's a song!"
I was sure she was wrong—
More a teakettle sound in my ear.

limerick_list.author: Workshop
limerick_list.text:
It was really my luckiest day:
For a pittance I bagged a fine tray.
The auction house said,
"Here's our bank details, Fred.
So please pay for the tray. No delay!"

limerick_list.author: mike scholtes
limerick_list.text:
The diagram drawn by Argand
In a polar-coordinate hand
Isn't meant to perplex,
But the plane is complex
So at first you might not understand.

limerick_list.author: Howard Spindel
limerick_list.text:
A schoolboy, residing in Chatham,
Used "atem" for "at them" and spat 'em
At the teacher, who pleaded
"You well know what's needed:
An apostrophe splitting the at 'em."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
When the dog star at dawn would appear,
Romans muttered, "The dog days are here."
The intense heat of summer
Can sure be a bummer.
Be of cheer; just relax with a beer.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
I defined for my medical final
The adjective corticospinal:
To the spine it pertains
And the cortex (the brain's)—
Not the nose, 'cause that goes under rhinal.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
You've a blotch on your face—that's the rumor—
And it isn't a subject for humor.
If it's painless and red
It may be, the doc said,
A benign angiomatous tumor.

limerick_list.author: VERaLOE and zqms
limerick_list.text:
Causing fear, causing terror or dread—
That's called fearsome, the dictionary said,
Like a zombie attack
Or a gun in your back.
Your escape? None in sight, till you're dead.

limerick_list.author: Kevin
limerick_list.text:
Cynophobia—how I fear dogs!
I find them more loathsome than frogs.
So I give them wide berth,
Which causes much mirth
For those thinking I'm short a few cogs.

limerick_list.author: Jason Talbott
limerick_list.text:
Turn eighteen and you get new permissions.
You can vote and sign legal petitions.
But you still can't drink beer,
And no change there next year:
The decennoval age lacks traditions.

limerick_list.author: zqms
limerick_list.text:
The accused's disclamation went: "No!
I deny that! My lawyer can show
I was not, at that time,
At the place of the crime."
(He'd prove anything though, for more dough.)

limerick_list.author: David
limerick_list.text:
Once a boar grimly grunted, "A warship
Is not the best place for my boarship.
If sailors come gunning,
I'll hog all the running —
Or end up as pork on their storeship."

limerick_list.author: Val
limerick_list.text:
It enfolds like invisible mist
Around people who find they exist
With joint empathy bared
Through experience shared.
Fellow feeling: the sense will persist.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Lucas
limerick_list.text:
Said urology patient, Max Hubble,
"My pee stream is coming out double.
One hits the bowl fine,
But the stray makes a line
For the floor."  Said the doc, "Urine trouble."

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
I hope our new puppy will kindle
A love that's sustained and won't dwindle.
He's tawny with black
That's in streaks on his back,
So I'd guess that we'd call him a brindle.

limerick_list.author: Kevin Dopart
limerick_list.text:
On shore there's a captain named Grace,
Known for keeping the men in their place;
She'd two frigid commands,
But now lets a few hands
Have more liberty 'round her third base.

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
"What our club needs," said Dag, "is a flag—
A bright banner, so members can brag!"
"I agree," added Neil,
"But let's make it of steel,
So on days without wind, it won't sag."

limerick_list.author: Bit
limerick_list.text:
If you need to make contact with me,
Use the Citizens' Band (or CB).
Hear that radio purr?
Maybe smoke signals were
A CB in 9,000 BC.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
As a teen on a fancy ranchero,
I dressed in a jaunty sombrero.
I was dashing and gay,
But I'm older today,
Just a hobbled and gray caballero.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
The man holds his breath as he waits
While his wife checks her diary: the dates
All add up — so they hope
(They're on pins, but they'll cope) —
They're expectant. Her belly inflates.

limerick_list.author: Bob Dvorak
limerick_list.text:
She'd had nine different ways to entwine.
Then he sighed, "We've done yours; let's try mine."
Said she, "Though I'm amenable
Your position's untenable.
Let's go and repeat number nine."

limerick_list.author: MikeAq
limerick_list.text:
Gabriello Fallopio'd hover
By bodies, their afterlife lover.
He'd find sinews and stuff,
Like an arch. Not enough?
The Fallopian tubes he'd discover!

limerick_list.author: PGS
limerick_list.text:
Once Buckingham, Nusselt, and Rayleigh
Developed a method that's daily
Applied (now conventional)
The so-called dimensional
analysis: Speedy not snaily!

limerick_list.author: Steve Andersen
limerick_list.text:
Abolitionary forces, arise!
Our cause is both worthy and wise.
For freedom we've fought;
We cannot be bought,
And neither should those other guys.

limerick_list.author: Goldie
limerick_list.text:
The speed cops will not derestrict
Quiet side streets, but don't think I'm licked.
Although racing my chopper
Is gross and improper,
I like getting residents ticked.

limerick_list.author: Chris Doyle
limerick_list.text:
A soldier writes home in a letter
That's officially read by a vetter.
This censor deletes
Any talk of defeats,
Since the less about that, well, the better.

limerick_list.author: Atticus Vere
limerick_list.text:
It's a wonderful site — simply dandy:
That arroyo bed's pebbled and sandy.
It's got gallets galore
(Simple mortar's a bore).
So collect some small bits; keep them handy.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
Took no time — made a hasty decision!
Now our child could receive much derision.
Do, please, tell me you've not
Rashly registered Spot
As our baby's name. That needs revision.

limerick_list.author: Jim Macaulay
limerick_list.text:
For a man, thick and tired, does it matter
If a diet makes midsections flatter?
In applying one's will
With no girth control pill,
It's a triumph of mind over platter.

limerick_list.author: rusty
limerick_list.text:
You've an equity case? It will clog,
Like bleak Jarndyce, cocooned in its quag,
Where the stern Lord High Chancellor
(Hope's withered canceller)
Sits at the heart of the fog.

limerick_list.author: CruzerX
limerick_list.text:
I went to a race in Bermuda:
Picked a bobtailed young nag, Barracuda.
With less hair on her end
She was first 'round the bend,
But fell back when she slipped in some doo-dah.

limerick_list.author: Sussexdownsman
limerick_list.text:
A burgee is a flag which you'll spy,
Of triangular shape, flying high
On a yacht or a boat
At its masthead. You'll note
It means yacht club allegiance. Aye aye!

limerick_list.author: SheilaB
limerick_list.text:
Seminarians cried to the cleric:
"Our dorm's got a stench atmospheric!"
"Your classmate is ill
With an ailment that will
Cause a stink, as his flu's dysenteric."

limerick_list.author: Roger Vick
limerick_list.text:
They embarked on plant etherization
(A presumptuous, odd, aberration).
The blossom-twig fuming
Was done to force blooming—
A winter bouquet the temptation.

limerick_list.author: Celia Warren
limerick_list.text:
These old roads are all long and quite straight,
Built with ditches each side, and they date
From the Romans — such feats:
Ermine and Watling Streets
And the Fosse Way in England. They're great.

limerick_list.author: Richard English
limerick_list.text:
To work in a garden is  gardening,
So useful for muscular hardening.
So why do I find
That it's not yet defined?
An omission for which there's no pardoning.

text: This is a test to see how well you are paying attention. This text is a series of limericks. At the end of the list of limericks, there will be a question. The question will be about one of the limericks. Please answer the question as concisely as possible.
